website_summaries.verdict: This is a good starter telescope for the beginning stargazer, but more advanced users may want something more powerful.
pros: No tools required to set it up
Good image quality for the price range
cons: Users have said the tripod isn't very sturdy and may tip over on a windy night

customer_reviews.title: easy out of the box???
customer_reviews.text: that's not what I was looking for when considering my first telescope, but this was one of their selling points anyway. it had good reviews, well priced, reputable company with nice online support. 3 wks later and we can't understand how to work it correctly. the included directions /manual appear as if made in 1950, horrible. even after googling and other websites, still not understanding what we are doing wrong. so disappointed!!!!! so I'm still staring at Mars from my deck with my own eyes as it gets smaller and smaller every day. what a missed opportunity very upsetting. don't recommend this company for a beginner.
customer_reviews.author: LL

customer_reviews.title: DONT'T BUY!
customer_reviews.text: missing pieces, shipped this thing faster than it traveled. didn't see crap, complicated assembling! WASTE of my precious time, I could have just played with my dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Too too heavy. Once set on tripod, no way to close. So cheap. Pics from one at Costco.
customer_reviews.text: So so cheap, ultimate crap. Try one at Costco store, or on line. Same brand but different model. Much lighter, and great quality. Pics taken are from Costco store model.
customer_reviews.author: BOMBAY prince

customer_reviews.title: Never worked correctly
customer_reviews.text: I am not an expert, but not completely new at this. But this telescope has never worked well. Not sure if it's defective or not set up correctly because of really poor instructions. Sure, we could see the moon okay, but no planetary details, moons, etc. Really disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony G. Picciano

customer_reviews.title: seems solid but may be tougher to get a good view than I thought
customer_reviews.text: Just got this 127 EQ a few days ago. Mars was looking good so I got the 24-8 zoom lense, and the Mars viewing package. Also got a Cheshire and laser collimator. I knew going in that the Celestron 127 EQ would be tough to collimate. But I did follow advise in this thread and, after removing the correcting lense and by virtue of a laser collimator, get it done. I first collimated the collimator (?). But here's my issue - when I'd get Mars, or Venus, in range, all I saw was what looked like the spider from the scope! Is my secondary mirror way out of whack? any ideas would be appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Skysoldier

customer_reviews.title: NOT Portable, and not for a place where you can't leave it permanently
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this telescope for my son's 14th birthday and it turned out to be a big mistake. It's very heavy, and so finicky once you aim it that it really can't be moved at all. It was also difficult to get the finder scope calibrated, to the point that my son and husband were very upset. Since we don't have a place (like a second floor or higher balcony, where it can be set up and left (hint, it's not weatherproof anyway), it's just taking up space in our living room until we can sell it. We were very disappointed. It's definitely for child amateurs, and I think there are better models out there, even for adults.
customer_reviews.author: TroubleEFG

customer_reviews.title: Good view of the moon and beyong
customer_reviews.text: I bought this telescope for my 5 years old son, he wanted to see Saturn, but the sky has been cloudy or we are not outside at the right time. So my second plan was to see the moon, I and very impressed with all the details and the quality of the image, compared to an Orion table top telescope that I bought also. The assembly was easy but, due to the size and weight of some components it may be difficult for some people, I would recommend having a second person around when assembling it, overall excellent telescope for begginers, I got a feeling of quality and durability when I use it. My skill level is "beginner".
customer_reviews.author: Ewduin

customer_reviews.title: Kind of disappointed of this telescope
customer_reviews.text: This was my first telescope I ever bought and, even with my very limited knowledge of telescopes, I could tell that this wasn't the greatest. The major issue is that it doesn't focus very well, there are plenty of aberrations that don't let you have a crystal clear view of stars, especially when using eyepieces 20 mm or less. The tripod is not the sturdiest, either, and it wiggles quite a bit when you move it. It has good magnification, but I found myself using the Celestron 70 mm travel telescope much more often than this one, and with much better image quality.
customer_reviews.author: Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The sight mount is designed for a different tube, and as a result it does not fit right. As a result even bumping it slightly will cause it to get out of alignment. One of the fine tuning gears is not made right, as there are metal shavings coming off of it, and it is hard to turn. 4mm eye peice has a bevel on it, making it almost impossible to mount a cell phone holder to it. I would ship it back if it wasn’t so much effort to do so, and I will not buy from this manufacturer or company again
customer_reviews.author: LacyAnneBeaman

customer_reviews.title: Not for chidlren or beginners not easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to get a good telescope to view the star, so bought that one. Assembly is OK to me, but it is quite challenge to use. It's hardly to locate the stars I want to view. Also it's not so powerful as I thought. I used it to view Jupiter recently. I can see the 3 moons around Jupiter, but the largest view of Jupiter I can see is only like a split pea. Overall to me that telescope is only good to view the moon, and the planets in solar system. Not any others.
customer_reviews.author: dnschan

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: This is cheaply made, falls over easily, and is not easy to assemble. It doesn't work very well, and 2 of the parts came damaged. Customer service is very slowly and inept. I had to wait several months for replacement parts because they refused to answer emails. It took multiple emails every time to get a response, and even then they didn't respond clearly, coherently or to all my questions. The worst thing about this telescope is that, once you have it set up, it doesn't stay locked in place, so you can't get a good, stable view of anything.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Poor assembly instructions and directions
customer_reviews.text: The first experience is assembling the telescope. The instructions are poor, with low res photos that are wholly inadequate for a technical instrument. The second experience is learning how to use it—and this is equally frustrating. YouTube videos are the best bet, but you’ve got to hunt for them. After watching them, I still don’t understand how to use the thing properly (and I have advanced degrees, albeit not in astronomy). Third, as for looking at things, you can see the moon very well. For other things I think you need a very dark location, and definitely loads of patience.
customer_reviews.author: Caveat Emptor

customer_reviews.title: Searching the Sky
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for the wife and I as we live in an area that's great for star gazing. A bit disappointed with the view finder as I find it extremely difficult to look through it and see anything. Getting the spotting scope and the main mirror aligned was also a difficult task. I spent over an hour trying to get the spotting scope and main mirror aligned and was not able to sync them. They are somewhat close, and somewhat is being generous.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel E. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy, cheap made.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this telescope only to find out the company does not stand behind its warranty. The parts are faulty mainly the screws that hold the eye pieces will not tighten so you cannot get a clear view without it shaken. The adjustment handles come loose because they are crimped on with no backing. Should have stayed with my straight tube telescope, better quality. Just proves company profits over quality of goods, the corporate way.
customer_reviews.author: Steven M. Nickell

customer_reviews.title: Great first beginner telescope.
customer_reviews.text: I recently have gotten interested in astrophotography and wanted a telescope to use so I could see if it was something I wanted to continue doing. It was easy to assemble and easy to use. Although the slow motion controls do take a little getting used to if you're like me and never used them before. I'm really impressed with how it turned out and would recommend the 127eq to anyone that wanted to get into star gazing.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my husband for Father’s Day because he loves astronomy. He has never had a telescope and he loves this!! It was easy to assemble and it is very sturdy! It is much larger than I thought it would be and he has been able to enjoy it on clear nights. This is great for beginners can’t even imagine what a professional one would look like but this one works great and well worth the money!!
customer_reviews.author: N. Stickles

customer_reviews.title: ... got this for my husband and we both really love it for our first "more expensive" amateur telescope
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my husband and we both really love it for our first "more expensive" amateur telescope. We have been able to make our the rings around Saturn, see the layers in Jupiter's atmosphere, and see lots of detail on the moon. I just wish it came with some kind of nice storage case and that there was a way to keep it more steady when you are viewing because every little bump of the telescope makes the image shake really bad at such high magnifications. So just keep that in mind when buying because you might want a sturdier tripod or something, especially if you are viewing things with children.
customer_reviews.author: Marsha M.

customer_reviews.title: Shipping may jostle the lenses so the view out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Great scope. I am really happy with my first telescope purchase. Still working on learning the ins and outs of setting it up. So far I got great moon pictures. I recommend watching set up vids and how tos on lens alignment. Patience is key and it may seem difficult for first few tries.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Good price and quality
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a gift a year ago in 2017. Recipient is very pleased. He's taken it out into the countryside on bumpy back roads and able to really see celestial bodies. He's also used it on his balcony in the middle of Dallas and reports given all the light pollution, he can still discern and see rings of Saturn, moons of other planets, etc. Great beginner/entry telescope.
customer_reviews.author: sfd

customer_reviews.title: Not for beginners! We could not figure it out
customer_reviews.text: We just threw it in the trash. We’ve had it for months, couldn’t ever say anything through it. The instructions are terrible. And it seem like it was missing some pieces? We were hoping we could figure it out and get to see the sky, but no such luck. I waited too late to return it. It has a lot of turning handles that does this and that and seems very confusing. Definitely not for beginners.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon T

customer_reviews.title: One Small Thing..
customer_reviews.text: I like this telescope. Only problem I have is, that if I accidentally bump the small sight on top of the tube, it knocks it completely out of alignment. It's not kool having to line it up again... Other than that, a great value and a great telescope. I'm looking for the Milky Way this summer. Lots of good stuff out there to see in the night skies!
customer_reviews.author: Amy Madragana

customer_reviews.title: I love this telescope
customer_reviews.text: I love this telescope. I honestly did not believe that you could get a telescope as good as this for less than $200. So far, I have been able to see Jupiter and 3 of its moons. I have been able to see the moon, and it is truly "wow." I have also done some general star gazing and picked up a lot that you cannot see with the naked eye. My next targets are Saturn, Mars, and Pluto but I haven't had a night without cloud cover. I have not yet tried the software but hear it is good. We have been using the Sky Map mobile app to find objects of interest.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Dude

customer_reviews.title: Too complicated for a beginner! Nothing to see here!
customer_reviews.text: I spent a lot of time and effort assembling and studying how to use this telescope. It was extremely complicated and I have as yet never successfully viewed anything in the night sky with his telescope.
customer_reviews.author: David H.

customer_reviews.title: Wish I Bought a Different One.
customer_reviews.text: I had this product for over a year now and I must say I've wished I bought a different one. Main reason: Bad turning nobs for the fine tuning adjustments. They are so cheep and keep unscrewing off and there are so many times that even when they are on, nothing turns. Every time I use this I get frustrated when I have to set it up because something just doesn't seem to work right and it takes me way longer that it should. Would have been much happier spending more money on a scope that actually has decent tuning.
customer_reviews.author: TP

customer_reviews.title: A Great Product, in more ways than one.
customer_reviews.text: I won't fool ya, it's a real solid product. And you'll see that once you put it together (not hard at all and done in about 30 minutes). And I'm not any kind of mechanic. Even though it's not something easily portable, I was able to put together a simple 'transport case'. It's perfect for whenever we want to get a bit further away from ambient or City light refraction. Most importantly and FYI, its been great for reconnecting loved ones.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Renee

customer_reviews.title: Very good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter. it does a fair job on the constellations, have yet to point it to the moon or other planets. Am happy in that it came with an equatorial mount, Still working on the zeroing in, weather has not been cooperating. I would recommend the optional motor drive, and for those of you with a DSLR, get the t-mount adapter for your model. With the drive and the camera, should bet some excellent pics. Do experience some vibration when adjusting / viewing. I may look at adapting my FPV camera to it, them push out to a screen
customer_reviews.author: Kevin zelhart

customer_reviews.title: Moon scope, but that’s about it
customer_reviews.text: Still learning about this little tool, but I can say the tripod is useless. If you can get the damn thing pointed at anything, all you can do to see it, is to stand by it and look into the eyepiece- if you have to make an adjustment or focus- you’re screwed. The scope used to point the telescope is plastic and does not lock down. Hitting the full moon is about the best this thing will do- it’s cool to see the craters and ridges- but that’s about all this will see with the provided eyepieces.
customer_reviews.author: JT733

customer_reviews.title: I'm in love with this telescope <3
customer_reviews.text: This is my first telescope, and let me tell you, I LOVE IT!! I know it's an entry level telescope, but it's decent for us who want to buy our very first decent telescope. It's very easy to setup, the instructions are clear, but if you need further help, there's a YouTube video which shows step by step how to set it up. I highly recommend buying the Celestron Accessory Kit too. It includes 2 more eyepieces and 3 filters which highly improve the viewing experience.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: What more is there to say? READ MY REVIEWS ON ASTROPHOTOGRAPHY
customer_reviews.text: If you have any interest in seeing beyond our microcosm of life, then this is for you. I never used a telescope before, let alone a refraction telescope, this is easy to assemble and use. Since owning this, I have added a power focuser, along with an R.A. motorized alignment set up (had to make some modifications for it to work), those two add-ons make astronomy a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Good Price - You Get What You Pay For
customer_reviews.text: After putting the telescope together, we could not get it to work, AT ALL! We followed all of the steps when assembling it (which wasn’t easy) so we knew it was put together properly. It spent a few weeks as a living room decoration until our tech-savvy friend came over for the Super Blood Moon a few weeks ago. Somehow he managed to get it working and we were able to see some of the eclipse. It’s definitely not the greatest telescope but for the price it’s good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Telescope with Lots of Power
customer_reviews.text: It's a great telescope with lots of power, and I would only recommend this telescope for serious amateur astronomers who don't mind taking the extra steps to use it properly; collimation can be tricky, and if not dealt with correctly can lead to frustration. It is a variation of the Newtonian design (Bird Jones); in order to correctly collimate the secondary and primary mirrors, I recommend a laser collimator. Once the secondary mirror is laser collimated, you only have to adjust the primary mirror from time to time, which takes no time at all once you get the hang of it.
customer_reviews.author: Zbrushman

customer_reviews.title: Telescope Wish...Granted!
customer_reviews.text: Solid Telescope, Incredible Price! Very satisfied with this telescope. Read the reviews, weighed the odds and took a chance for my 50th Birthday present. The main Celestron box was packed within two other boxes. This scope is very easy to put together. I bought the VITE Laser Collimator to get it sighted in. It was dead on right out of the box. I was able to take it out a couple of times before the weather turned cold. Beautiful views of the moon. Prepare to buy better lens. The ones that come with the scope are very inexpensive. And, you'll definitely need to buy a Moon Filter.
customer_reviews.author: C.E.B.

customer_reviews.title: Broken. Buy a more expensive telescope.
customer_reviews.text: One of the parks broke upon putting this together. I haven’t been able to use it since. 😭 I intend to buy a replacement part if I can find one.
customer_reviews.author: Shelley S.

customer_reviews.title: The only fault that i can see it that the sight is not in a good spot as I have to use my left eye ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this a s a Christmas present and it is the first one. I have seen things i never thought I would see. It let me see the craters on the moon so far and I expect to see so much more. The only fault that i can see it that the sight is not in a good spot as I have to use my left eye and walk around the scope itself to see things, which poses a problem if you knock into it you have to sight it back in.
customer_reviews.author: mrisk

customer_reviews.title: Not a good choice without training
customer_reviews.text: Has great optics, but it is very difficult to use on the German equatorial mount as a beginner. I watched multiple videos on how to align and the use. Doesn't work as easy.as they.say. the slightest touch moves the sighting and your back at trying to reacquire your object.
customer_reviews.author: James C. Lindsey Jr

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love this telescope! Just starting to get into the hobby, and this was a good balance of price vs. capability for beginning with a reflector telescope. The equitorial mount requires some getting used to, and the mirrors had to be aligned (which I was prepared for since it came UPS). Both have plenty of online resources and how-tos (Youtube, forums, etc..) Its been cloudy lately, so I don't have any decent photos of any planets, but the moon is gorgeous. Great product :)
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: High quality construction and finish. Not excellent customer support, and quite complicated for beginners. The manual is very basic, but they offer more detailed information on their site. Optic quality overall has been decent so far, need to test it further on longer distances.
customer_reviews.author: amanda

customer_reviews.title: Ok for kids
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad scope for the price. Bought it for our 12 year old's bday. Can see the moon in good detail, saturns larger rings and moons, Mars shows minimal detail. Jupiter is ok and can see the dots of its moons. If you're buying this for a kid or dabbling in backyard astronomy don't buy an EQ mount like this, look for an alt-az mount. EQ mounts are a pain if you're unfamiliar with them. Only complaint specific to this scope other than the mount is the thumb screws are really, really easy to lose when setting it up outside or taking it down and getting replacements from celestron is a nightmare.
customer_reviews.author: LongrodVonHugendong

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of garbage. I could see more with a pair of binoculars. Idk who really posting those reviews but under 3 times zoom and open star sky all I could see was dots less clearly than with my own two eyes
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the telescope but...
customer_reviews.text: The only downside to this that I've found so far is that it's REALLY sensitive to touch, so if you finally get what you're looking at lined up and in focus and you accidentally put pressure on the eyepiece with your eye, you'll have to readjust to find what you're looking for again.
customer_reviews.author: J. Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to assemble, not easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This telescope is not easy to assemble also not easy to use. I purchased last week and it took me a long time to assemble. And the instruction is print as blurred and not clearly describes what should we do. After I assemble it, hard to find the target and focus. The image is always blurred.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: Not easy set up out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Returned item. Was unable to calibrate scope without buying extra equipment. Not easy to set up straight out of the box like the instructions said.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great, If you have prior Telescope experience
customer_reviews.text: This would probably be great for someone that has prior "advanced" telescope experience but as a newbie-- it is too complicated. Find myself scanning the sky by hand vs using all the knobs also other then the moon-- things are very hard to bring into focus enough to see details. after 3 weeks I ended up putting it back in the box and will save it for "some day" or try to resale. Directions are very scientific-- "axis" and words like that that normal people just do not use.
customer_reviews.author: Kammie Wold

customer_reviews.title: Spotting scope is worthless; get a red dot finder scope to make this useful
customer_reviews.text: Spotting scope is worthless. Buy a red dot finder scope to make this useful. Spotting scope that comes with it is absolute garbage. The Celestron Star Pointer finder scope for an additional $20 makes this scope very useful. I was able to align the finder scope with the moon and can now easily site on Jupiter and Saturn like a pro. I added an SV205 camera and am getting good images.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P. Fons

customer_reviews.title: Not For Beginners
customer_reviews.text: This is not for The first time user in telescope's. I am super tech savy with lots of thing's but this thing made me feel like i was a neanderthal. I did not have a chance to use it at all as it wouldn't hold a setting as well so i cannot comment on what it see's. Maybe a auto one is best for beginner's. As usual Amazon always takes good care of it's customers and i will try another one in the future for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Theoneman

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed in the quality out of the box. One of the control knobs has a stripped hole, and the other is questionable as to how long it will last. If you look at my photo, you can see that the hole is too big on the longer controller, and too close to the end on the short one. Good grief.
customer_reviews.author: Lurchbird

customer_reviews.title: Celestron - PowerSeeker 127EQ Telescope - Manual German Equatorial Telescope for Beginners
customer_reviews.text: A very nice beginner's telescope. The stability isn't so great, though, since it's so light but place some sandbags on it and it'll help a lot. Obviously not very stable in the wind either. A nice scope and good overall value, though.
customer_reviews.author: Q!

customer_reviews.title: Beginner's Telescope
customer_reviews.text: Great product for a beginner even when they are over 60 years old. Husband always wanted one but never purchased. Only one part was broken and he dealt directly with the company who responded with a replacement part free of charge immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbie

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it
customer_reviews.text: Dificult to assemble, heavy, too big... I regret buying this!! I don't see anything by this!! Really bad!!
customer_reviews.author: Valderene

customer_reviews.title: My advice, spend more for  better scope
customer_reviews.text: Not as good as I had hoped, looks good, but hard to use. The finder scope to me is worthless, the mount works but not well. If you just want to look at the moon with a low power it's okay, but the stars and planets are a waste of time. I wish I spent a little more money for a better one because I have no use for this one. I'll probably take it to the pawn shop, or just keep it for a decoration.
customer_reviews.author: pauline adrian milana

customer_reviews.title: There is a subreddit on reddit.com called r/dontbuyapowerseeker
customer_reviews.text: See many more details about how it's bad on that subreddit. Just my personal experience about how it's bad: 1. It's a Bird-Jones type telescope (see other reviews here for more information about that) which means that collimating it is not straightforward. This information was not included in the instructions... 2. The mount and counter weights were not strong enough to allow using it. So when other lenses that we'd bought were used it was impossible to balance (meaning that trying to put things in view was very difficult). We weren't happy with it and have bought a different model.
customer_reviews.author: David Resnick

customer_reviews.title: We needed to do more research before purchasing
customer_reviews.text: I love the way it looked but we couldn't get it to work. Being a telescope owning virgin the only time we have ever looked through one was when someone else found the object to veiw and we just looked through. We couldn't find even the moon in the sky and it was almost full. I feel like we may have missed something or put it together wrong. More research on our part was needed. As well as someone to show us how to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift for a space/star lover.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 9 year old son for his birthday. Is perfect for him. Was able to see the moon in great detail...showing him how the moon rotates as well as the earth. Haven't tried to see any further objects as of yet. Only con I see is the instability of when trying to fine tune magnification...was a tad wobbly. Other than that...is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Smith

customer_reviews.title: Finder scope is god awful
customer_reviews.text: The finder scope is god awful every time I try to use this telescope it never stops falling no matter how I adjust it and if I get it to stop it’s way off from where it needs to be. I’ve only focused it on the moon one time which was definitely worth it, it looked amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew V.

customer_reviews.title: Great scope for the money
customer_reviews.text: There are some features on this scope that feel somewhat advanced to me. I've not been able to fully set this up to make tracking easier but that hasn't stopped me from seeing some cool stuff. Amazing detail on the moon, Neptune, rings of Saturn.
customer_reviews.author: LoonyHat

customer_reviews.title: Nothing about this is easy...it’s a total pain unless you know astronomy already
customer_reviews.text: Nothing about this is easy or a beginner. It took an hour aand a half to assemble. The instructions weren’t for the correct model either. Once assembled we spent another hour and and a half trying to see anything in the sky. We had to call it a night. I regret buying this telescope as a gift. I feel awful about it. Worst purchase.
customer_reviews.author: UrNOTKITTEN

customer_reviews.title: Good starter.
customer_reviews.text: This was my first EQ mount telescope. Good price. Slow motion controls are good. The EQ mount could use a little tightening up. Bearings maybe. But I'm sure that would raise the price. If your looking to take pictures with it? Maybe a better telescope would do better. But as a starting scope? I thought it was really good for the price. Once you start...you will be hooked. Then you will be looking for a better mount and maybe a bigger mirror..maybe like an 8 inch. And a tracking mount.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I still cant see a thing Literally nothing anyone can help comment below please
customer_reviews.text: I have a model of a telescope cause this thing cant see the moon let alone a plane in the sky instructions aren't the best but after 3 separate YouTube videos its together but doesn't work I'm wondering is it possible to get a defective telescope I'm giving 5 stars because it came much faster than expected huge plus and it was in good shape when unpackaged only issue may be on my end I cant see anything out of it
customer_reviews.author: Francisco

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Telescope
customer_reviews.text: This is a very high-quality, solid telescope at a great price. I bought it as a gift for my Dad, and he LOVES it. Very high magnification, we have spent hours looking at the night sky and the craters on the moon, other planets, stars. Crystal-clear imaging, very easy to use, and solid, heavy construction. This is no cheap plastic telescope. For the price you cannot beat this. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: GFordyce1

customer_reviews.title: Great to start!
customer_reviews.text: I've never used a telescope before and this is great for beginners. It's not the easiest or most high tech. The counter weight actually swung and hit my head when I was trying to adjust it. It can be tricky to get used to the adjustments and everything. Once you get the hang of it, it's great!
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Not for beginners.
customer_reviews.text: How the &%$^ does this thing work? Lmao have pieces everywhere. Should have gotten a hand held.
customer_reviews.author: Maria C.

customer_reviews.title: Review for the Celestron 12EQ PowerSeeker
customer_reviews.text: I got this for the family as a Christmas gift. First night I set it up, second night I figured out what I messed up setting it up, and the third night I found Jupiter. Took me a while to really focus everything in. I'm definitely a novice but I have prior experience with other basic telescopes. This is just as simple only bigger. I gave it 4 stars because it is a bit clumsy to set up and the spotting scope kind of stinks. Other than that, for the money, it rocks.
customer_reviews.author: Dad of Bomber the Dog

customer_reviews.title: Damaged/used  product resold as new
customer_reviews.text: Got it out of the box and immediately noticed that it was missing two lenses, had no software included, and no manual. Then also noticed after assembling almost completely, that the spotting scope had been broken and super glued back together. Not happy. I will be returning it immediately for refund. This was sold as NEW, not used. Pissed.
customer_reviews.author: Celia Garner

customer_reviews.title: Quality made.
customer_reviews.text: The pieces came packaged really well. The fact that it doesn't come fully assembled, makes it fun for those who like to put together objects. The person I gave this to was ready to swing on a star & carry moonbeams home in a jar! ;)
customer_reviews.author: svzen16

customer_reviews.title: Good telescope for an amateur.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Lil telescope. It's a bit heavy for transportations, you probably won't take this in your back pack. But loving the power of this thing. Just a bit of advise, make sure you lubricate all the gears. I almost busted the cabled gear adjustments cause the gear was binding. Other than that everything work as it's supposed to. Overall I love this Celesteron Powerseeker 127 EQ. Would recommend it to everyone. You just need to know how to use the Equitoral mount.
customer_reviews.author: Larance Fredrickson

customer_reviews.title: Only buy this if you are looking for a cheap beginner scope and are OK with the flaws that come with it.
customer_reviews.text: It is an OK beginner scope. Not high quality build but works well. The finder scope is a joke. We will upgrade at some point but meanwhile this will do. The flaws do not preclude a good viewing experience. The 20mm we got is generating an internal shadow of the object observed. Clear evidence that they are not high quality. But then again this is the cheapest scope in its range.
customer_reviews.author: Burlingamer

customer_reviews.title: Celestron is kaput
customer_reviews.text: Beyond disappointed. Several factory flaws. Bent parts. Terrible. Zero quality control. Upon receipt, assembly was a complete disaster. Broken. Right back to Bezos. Total trash. My kid's 14th birthday, ruined. RUINED.
customer_reviews.author: SeñorAllballs

customer_reviews.title: Came damaged
customer_reviews.text: Cover came broken inside scope plastic all over mirror. Perhaps a good scope but mine came in damaged
customer_reviews.author: Ibrahim maouad

customer_reviews.title: Good scope for the price
customer_reviews.text: When I first saw the assembling instructions I had to YouTube videos to help. Brutal honesty. It was a bit intimidating opening it all up. But I completely panicked when I looked at the clamp. Thought it was missing a screw. But it's ok by the time you get to that part of putting it together. Good scope for the price! Btw, I saw Orion's Nebula with it. Not like Hubble pics, though lol
customer_reviews.author: Heather Weekley

customer_reviews.title: Usable but may be a turnoff to astronomy.
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad telescope but very cheap parts, but for the price you get what you pay for. First the instructions were a bit confusing. Second the focuser is sloppy, eyepieces were cheap plastic. Not very solid but like I said you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Logan

customer_reviews.title: don't buy if not an expert or you are busy
customer_reviews.text: The telescope is a pure time pit. It is complicated to assemble, takes a long time get it right. It is even more complicated to use. It will take hours/days to master using it. So unless you already know how to do it, think long and hard because the damn thing is a commitment.
customer_reviews.author: Dutch

customer_reviews.title: Say what?!?!!?!
customer_reviews.text: I've looked up the sky for 4 decades. I've seen the bright dots that are planets but never really thought about it. I bought this telescope for my daughter, who is 7 and loves to talk about the things I watch on the Science Channel. I set it up, which was very easy, and I pointed at Jupiter. Suddenly that bright point in the sky had a giant red spot, bands of clouds, and several moons. Holy ****! Why didn't I get one of these years ago? Totally over the moon with this telescope. (Pun totally intended)
customer_reviews.author: M. A. Doroudian

customer_reviews.title: Very happy entry level astronomer here.
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this as a first telescope. Beautiful views of the moon, stars and planets. I would recommend the purchase of the add-on filters. For example, to properly view the moon, a moon filter is required. The add-on kit includes additional optics and filters that really round this telescope out nicely. Setup was simple and straightforward, and there are lots of additional components that can be purchased. For example, a camera mount. As an entry level person, I'm very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: David P.

customer_reviews.title: Not a Beginners Scope
customer_reviews.text: Between the complexity of collimating the mirror and using the equatorial mount, this is not a suitable scope for a beginner unless they will be learning from an experienced star gazer. That being said, it’s very good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Good thing I'm Mr. Fix it!
customer_reviews.text: I like it,to just some of the parts like the plastic lens are just ok the tri pod is wobbly and not big enough for the scope the scope need to be collenied Wright off the bat so it's ok you have to know telescopes to fix it Yaa ok😣
customer_reviews.author: Amandas lost again!

customer_reviews.title: Having lots of fun
customer_reviews.text: Can get a good view of the moon with the lenses that come with it. This is my 1st telescope and it's been a good experience. I plan on buying better lenses for it so I can get a good view of Mars. Managed to focus in on Mars 1 time but it was just a tiny dot still. I love this telescope though.
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: Images kind of blurry?
customer_reviews.text: Well for starters it was great at viewing the moon, jupiter as a small white dot and it’s moons, mars is a red blob, and Saturn is a small dot and a ring around it but very blurry. I see some of the pictures on here looking very sharp and I can’t get my Celestron 127eq to match it. I live in Colorado Springs so it may just be the area in which I’m viewing. The adjusting pieces rent too good they are hard to turn and shaky. The finderscope is decent once set accordingly. Can somebody help me so that my images could get as sharp as other viewers?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I still love it........
customer_reviews.text: I love it!! It's my new work horse!!! So much easier than my older galileo to carry, and a bigger mirror is a BIG help too. So I'm working on what I need for magnification, and it will the one I use the most.............and now I have a question. I'm wondering for those using this model. I want to know if anyone has added extra weight to their scopes, and if you have does it help the scope stay where you place it?? I know it all depends on the weight of the eyepiece, but I think there's just not enough weight on lightweight eyepieces. Thanx........Dora
customer_reviews.author: Dora

customer_reviews.title: Worked great right out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: Have read some reviews about focusing issues out of the box, but not with mine. Setup was easy, and it operates and focuses great! Many comments about how this is just an entry level scope, but it works great for myself, as well as my Granddaughters to star gaze. For the money, no complaints and am happy with the purchase. Not compensated in any way either for this review, purchased outright.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: and stars like Sirius. Also purchased the celestron 5 piece lense ...
customer_reviews.text: Despite being intimidated by a lot of reviews that it needs adjustment and it takes a lot of practice and patience to get it right, it was perfectly collimated right out of the box. No adjustment needed. Within 10 minutes of really simple assembly, got really sharp images of lunar surface, jupiter and its moons, and stars like Sirius. Also purchased the celestron 5 piece lense kit. Great for first timers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Telescope is great, but the instructions included are not for the ...
customer_reviews.text: Telescope is great, but the instructions included are not for the actual telescope ordered. The instructions are for two other model telescopes similar. The instructions do not help put this telescope together even trying to follow the pictures of the telescopes in the instruction manual are no help. We finally called friends who had received the same telescope last year and they helped assemble and set up. They said they had the same problem with the instruction Manuel and had to call one of their professors to help them assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Strong

customer_reviews.title: Major Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Worst gift ever. Bought this for my 11 year old and he could not use it. Can’t get a clear picture through the view finder. Everything is loose and poor quality. Looks good, doesn’t work.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Hmmmm...
customer_reviews.text: Not for beginners... How to book is non existent... It is a lovely hat rack though...
customer_reviews.author: Sondra

customer_reviews.title: Great deal for the price!
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is a great telescope. It took a long time to assemble and there were a couple of pieces that I feel could have been built a little better but it is great for the experienced star gazer. I would not recommend for a beginner as it takes some getting used to and once you find a large target such as the moon, you need to be familiar with how to operate a telescope to follow it.
customer_reviews.author: Marcella Rose

customer_reviews.title: For the money this is a great telescope. There are a few minor inconveniences
customer_reviews.text: For the money this is a great telescope. There are a few minor inconveniences, i.e. really heavy once counter weight is attached and the finder scope would have been better if the adjustment screw where of a better design( to much time I think in trying to get it to align with the telescope itself) that's why I did not give it a 5 stars , but nothing that would stop the enjoyment that I am getting out of it so far. Have ordered some accessories and should be good to go when they come in. These photo where taken tonight just using a canon powershot ELPH 160 close to the len, not to bad.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Save for something better.
customer_reviews.text: Impossible to collimate and focuser way to loose. Stand was shaky and gears were too tight to move smoothly which made metal shavings come of. Total waste of money. Do your research and save up for a real beginner scope recommended by astronomy forums (subreddit r/telescopes for starters) instead of going with your top search result with decent “star” rating.
customer_reviews.author: R. Young

customer_reviews.title: Would Only Recommend for Experts
customer_reviews.text: This is massive. I had my brother set it up for me. However it is kind of awkward if you need to lean it back because of the size and bulk. I found it also to be overly sensitive in trying to focus and align. Any kind of touch and/or jostle will move it right out of alignment before you've had time to lock it in. Would have returned but setup was a monster.
customer_reviews.author: JR Account

customer_reviews.title: Poor design for the price
customer_reviews.text: I tried to see the stars with it and calibration was out of question and thats not the only thing that made me return the item, the whole thing was not stable at all on the tripod, very sensitive.
customer_reviews.author: Toli   KY

customer_reviews.title: Great starter package
customer_reviews.text: This is my first telescope I'm still learning daily but the customer service is excellent that's very important this day and age rarely do you have such good customer service from anyone anymore
customer_reviews.author: Gmanfal

customer_reviews.title: Side finder scope is ridiculous, flimsy.
customer_reviews.text: This is so fiddly. The side scope used to get a general area (with less magnification) is very cheap feeling, difficult to impossible to get calibrated/aimed properly due to cheap plastic parts. I think the actual telescope is probably pretty good, but you need this finder scope to aim, so it is pretty hard to use. I almost sent it back but got caught up in work and couldn't box it up in time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I Thought This Would Be Better Than It Is
customer_reviews.text: I'm not an expert on telescopes, but I noticed a couple of things about this one that bother me. For one, the small sight scope that mounts on top is nearly impossible to set up so that it stays in accurate alignment with the main scope. It's cheap plastic, and one little bump will throw it off. The other thing is the main eye piece - you have to hold your head steady with your eye perfectly centered or you won't see anything through it. Nice views of the moon, but after about 1 minute it's too tiring to keep looking. Anything smaller than the moon is just going to look like a slightly bigger light in the sky.
customer_reviews.author: A. Burgess

customer_reviews.title: It is a great product! I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: This the first telescope I bought and It is amazing! I could see the moon, Saturn and its moons and Jupiter as well, great for newbies like me, it is obviously not close to those crazy and sophisticated telescopes and it is awesome if you want to spend time with your family.
customer_reviews.author: Toro Arzhaga

customer_reviews.title: Larger than expected learnng curve.
customer_reviews.text: Well, I wanted to see Saturn with my naked eye and this telescope. Can it be done, yes. Is it easy, no. I suppose some knowledge of how these things operate would be beneficial. Starting from scratch was kind of rough, however, as a hobby and spending a few hours here and there and you get the hang of it and see some pretty cool things.
customer_reviews.author: Eric H.

customer_reviews.title: need help or a replacement
customer_reviews.text: we got this item celestron power seeker 127 EQ telescope was not able to use it can not see nothing out of think it factory defected got it on December 24 as a christmas present several family member try to help and nothing that any body out there can help or know if we ca get replacement
customer_reviews.author: zeidy abarca

customer_reviews.title: Nice value telescope
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for one my children for Christmas and we assembled it easily. It's of decent quality construction and a step up from telescopes we've had in the past. I found that aiming the sighting scope was easiest for me by pointing the telescope at something distinct and as distant as possible inside the house and then looking through the telescope itself without any eyepiece at the blurry image. After lining that up I adjusted the sighting scope on the same spot or barely above it. Now we have a very functional telescope that gathers a lot of light and provides good magnification.
customer_reviews.author: WhatsTheHurry?

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: This is outstanding, I use it all the time. It is supper easy to put together and I love that it can be put in a duffel bag when I go on trips.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell R

customer_reviews.title: Not great for beginners
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited for this one. After several tries to align the mirrors, we finally called in an expert from our local astronomy club. After a few hours of fiddling, we discovered we had a defective scope and had to send it back. This was our first scope and assembly was not that easy for us and this mount is beyond terrible. Very unstable and shaky. Even if we had been able to find something in the scope, this mount would've made viewing difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Rainorshine

customer_reviews.title: Very cheap material
customer_reviews.text: This is a very cheaply made product. The design needs a lot of improvement. The cheap metals used cause a thumb screw to strip out when I hand tightened it. Do yourself a favor and spend a bit more if you don’t want a broken telescope hanging around your house.
customer_reviews.author: J.C.

customer_reviews.title: Telescope is great; trouble with the mount.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband and we've had it for about a month. The telescope part is great, but last night when we tried to use it one of the height adjustment screws on the mount cross-threaded, stuck, and then broke off. It was only the second time we'd used it. However, the company was great. When we called about the broken screw, they offered to repair the mount if we paid shipping to send it in. That was something we were willing to do. When we asked if the screw was a common problem, they said they'd never heard of it happening before. All in all, I'm happy with the telescope, but the mount caused a few problems.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Love the telescope when looking at the moon
customer_reviews.text: Love the telescope when looking at the moon. Getting a 3 star because i cant seem to focus on anything beyond our moon, and the customer service is a bit slow in responding to you. However they will CALL you and walk you through the process of what potential problem and troubleshooting you may need. I am still new to this so it might be my fault, but focusing should just be that. Not sure whats going on, but i will try again. Otherwise the clarity when using this thing is outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: Alex C. Reeves

product_meta.title: Celestron - PowerSeeker 127EQ Telescope - Manual German Equatorial Telescope for Beginners - Compact and Portable - BONUS Astronomy Software Package - 127mm Aperture
product_meta.description: Amateur astronomers will love the user-friendly features of Celestron’s PowerSeeker series of entry-level telescopes. The Celestron PowerSeeker 127EQ is an easy-to-use and powerful telescope. PowerSeeker Series Celestron telescopes have been designed with a combination of value, quality, power, and user-friendly features to enhance the experience for novice telescope users. This 127EQ telescope is the perfect choice for families in search of a high-quality telescope that is affordable and provides years of enjoyment. Powerful magnification and easy-to-use controls allow astronomers to obtain crisp views of the Moon, the rings of Saturn, and Jupiter’s Galilean moons. The telescope’s sturdy and durable mount features large, easy-to-manipulate slow-motion control knobs, allowing users to track objects smoothly. The 3x Barlow lens is added to triple the magnification power of the included 20mm and 4mm eyepieces. This essentially provides you with four eyepieces, giving you flexibility to view a wide range of outdoor or celestial objects. We’ve included an accessory tray to store accessories conveniently and a free download of our BONUS Starry Night Basic Edition astronomy software with information on 10, 000 celestial objects, printable sky maps, and more. The software can be used on your Mac, PC or laptop. It’s the best way to learn about the night sky and plan your next observing session. Additional accessories include a travel tripod. You can purchase this Celestron telescope with confidence from the world’s #1 telescope brand, based in California since 1960. You’ll also receive a 2-year and unlimited access to technical support from our team of US-based experts. Tom Johnson founded Celestron in 1960 after building a telescope to share the night sky with his sons. Since then, Celestron has established itself as the world’s #1 telescope brand. Celestron telescopes are used by scientists in world-class research observatories and even aboard the International Space Station. To ensure you have a great experience your first night under the stars, please refer to the User Guide in the Technical Specifications section below.
feature_bullets: PERFECT ENTRY-LEVEL TELESCOPE: The Celestron PowerSeeker 127EQ is an easy-to-use and powerful telescope. The PowerSeeker series is designed to give the new telescope user the perfect combination of quality, value, features, and power

MANUAL GERMAN EQUATORIAL MOUNT: Navigate the sky with our Newtonian Reflector telescope. It features a German Equatorial mount with a slow-motion altitude rod for smooth and accurate pointing. Adjust rod to desired position, then easily secure by tightening cross knob

COMPACT AND PORTABLE: This telescope for adults and kids to be used together is compact, lightweight, and portable. Take the telescope to your favorite campsite or dark sky observing site, or simply the backyard

MULTIPLE ACCESSORIES: The Celestron PowerSeeker 127EQ Telescope comes with two eyepieces (20mm and 4mm), plus a 3x Barlow lens to triple the power of each. Users can also download BONUS Starry Night Astronomy Software Package

UNBEATABLE AND CUSTOMER SUPPORT: Buy with confidence from the world’s #1 telescope brand, based in California since 1960. You’ll also receive a 2-year and unlimited access to technical support from our team of US-based experts

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars2,979 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
